name: Seltzer et al. v. Markovitz Bros., Inc., et al., Appellants

judges: Before Maxey, C. J.,Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearne and Hughes, JJ.
parties: Seltzer et al. v. Markovitz Bros., Inc., et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Opinion, by
Mr. Chief Justice Maxey,
The question we have just decided in the case of Volta v. Markovitz Brothers, Inc., 351 Pa. 243, is precisely the same question as is raised by the pleadings in this case and our opinion and decision in that case apply to this case.
The judgment is affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Chief Justice Maxey,

attorneys: Henry 8. Ambler, with him Frank R. Ambler, for appellants, original defendants.
John J. McDevitt, Jr., for appellee, additional defendant.
casebody.head_matter:
Seltzer et al. v. Markovitz Bros., Inc., et al., Appellants.
Argued December 6,1944.
Before Maxey, C. J.,Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearne and Hughes, JJ.
Henry 8. Ambler, with him Frank R. Ambler, for appellants, original defendants.
John J. McDevitt, Jr., for appellee, additional defendant.
January 2, 1945:
